title: Mobility Creep should be looked at during pre-season in addition to Damage
body:
Starting with mobility runes that should in my opinion be straight up deleted. Runes that give movespeed such as Predator, Relentless Hunter and Celerity.  Regardless of how good or bad champions like Hecarim are in the current meta, should a build that involves running at you with 600+ movespeed and one shotting you really be supported? Giving already highly mobile champions more move speed serves only to remove counterplay and increase frustration.

Mobility Runes mainly benefit champions that are already highly mobile giving them insane move speed and engage potential on immobile champions. In the build up to last pre season Riot showcased Predator as something to be taken on champions like {{champion:91}}. Why would you create a rune specifically to add more mobility to a champion who already has a dash, and movespeed increase and the ability to jump over walls???? This shows that the intent of this Rune was simply to make mobile champions more mobile. Talon as it turns out does not usually take Predator, and its uses are just a bunch of niche/abuse cases allowing for cheesey engages/one shots.

Mobility Runes are usually not taken by and considerably less effective on immobile champions(%move speed increase is lower with lower movespeed giving little benefit) so their existence is essentially just to make champions with gap closers stronger.

Second, some champions with high mobility need trade offs. 
Why do  some high mobility champions sometimes have more damage,cc and more innate durability than immobile champions?

Riot: We've decided to take a look at mobility creep. Our approach is targeting a few problem champions in order to bring down some of the outliers.

Riot: {{champion:98}}, {{champion:113}}, {{champion:6}}, {{champion:516}}, and {{champion:127}} no longer have dashes. There will be no compensation buffs.

Community: Oh god we're all screwed.

I'm with you on this 100%. Mobile champs don't pay nearly enough right now for having insane mobility in their kits comparing to immobile champions. It's most seen in comparison with mages/assassins,where the latter group doesn't get nerfs to compensate their ridiculous cheese. 
However,more than just rune deletion/changing would be required. As it stands,the game is already hugely revolved around mobility. There is more of it than ever before. You'd need to adjust mobile champions' kits as well as runes to put them on par with immobiles,or buff the latter. Right now,immobility is a huge drawback and I despise Riot for making the game revolve around dashes and blinks so heavily there is no way back from it. Especially because mobile cancer dominates this game and nothing is being done about it.

{{champion:34}} damage, cc. Trade off: immobile, squishy, mobility renders her kit almost useless
 {{champion:39}} damage, cc, durability, mobility, unique form of cc only she has (disarm) trade off: Almost none besides cc shuts her down but cc shuts down every champion.

Captain obvious conclusion: Mobile champs need to give up a little more of their kits plain and simple.

I dont want to disagree or anything but , you cant compare irelia's and camille's cc with that of an average mage.  Irelia's and camille's cc (stun) lasts for 0.75 second compared to anivia's 1.1-1.5 sec.

Also, there's one very important thing. 

Irelia and Camille need to be on your face to deal any kind of damage.

Anivia and Brand can kill you from +600 range, while Vel'koz can kill you from a screen away.

I have no idea why mages and ADCs never take range as a strength, while range is most important strength in the game. There's a reason why Tristana or Kog are the hypercarries, while guys like Darius or Camille aren't.

Which is why irelia and camille are have more resistances than ranged champs, and their kits are equipped with tools to help them survive.  And you are right, range is indeed a strength. However mages have a bit of unreliable range. So to be fair, as mage, your strength when it stems from your range is very unstable.  Unreliable spells are the most common. Try landing lux's or zigg's q at max range. Its almost impossible.  Even xerath's q is difficult to land if the enemy is constantly on guard.  So yeah nowadays, mages having range means very little since they triple pay their range through no mobility  (except ziggs for some flying reason) , squishyness and unreliable spells.
